revised_title: Clive Forster-Cooper's Life and Contributions to Zoology and Paleontology
tldr: Clive Forster-Cooper was a notable zoologist and paleontologist who made significant contributions to the fields of vertebrate paleontology and zoology. He conducted expeditions to the Maldives and Bugti beds, collecting valuable specimens of fossil mammals. Forster-Cooper also worked on medical research during World War I and was a dedicated teacher and lecturer, mentoring many distinguished zoologists.
